alert.note: Alert for Bosque; Hamilton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued October 26 at 12:35AM CDT until October 26 at 3:30AM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: The National Weather Service in Fort Worth has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Western Bosque County in central Texas... Central Hamilton County in central Texas... * Until 330 AM CDT. * At 1235 AM CDT, Emergency management reported flash flooding was ongoing across the warned area with at least one water rescue in progress after a vehicle was swept off a roadway. Between 4 and 8 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 1 inch in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Hamilton, Meridian, Hico, Iredell, Cranfills Gap, Meridian State Park, Walnut Springs, Morgan, Norse, Eulogy, Fairy, Olin, Whiteway, Jonesboro, Carlton, Aleman, Gentrys Mill and Brazos Point. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1 INCH IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
